text: Leucopogon gracilis is a shrub in the family Ericaceae found in Western Australia. It was first described in 1810 by Robert Brown, and the specific epithet, gracilis, is the Latin adjective gracilis ("slender", "thin", or "graceful") describing the plant as slender and graceful. A holotype, K000348592, collected by Robert Brown at King George's Sound is kept in the Kew Royal Botanic Gardens Herbarium (K). ==References== gracilis Category:Ericales of Australia Category:Flora of Western Australia Category:Plants described in 1810 Category:Taxa named by Robert Brown (botanist, born 1773)
title: Leucopogon gracilis
